title: Paradigm for special interest infrastructure support
body:
We are planning on implementing more convenient support for gdrive interaction, namely

- setup a gdrive as a special remote via rclone
- publish by combining a special remote with storage of a (zipped-up) repository, using an approximation of a ria store
- clone from gdrive (i.e. download, extract, re-annex init)

This will end up being a lot of custom code for gdrive. There are two basic paradigm that I can see re how to integrate that with the rest of the code base.

- add pieces of functionality to existing commands where they make sense (an example of a first step is #4162 by @adswa)
- centralize gdrive-focused functionality in a dedicated command and keep the others clean(er)

There are advantages to both approach, but also disadvantages. In #4162 we can see how, an already complex `siblings` needs to be blown up. With the `create-sibling*()` family I see more evidence that uniformity is not practical. And `publish` is not (yet) in the position to be extended to anything beyond `git/git-annex` `push/pull/copy`.

I am currently investigating an alternative path, where I am trying to use git-remote helpers to give native access to a gdrive via an rclone mount. And this might be a model for it https://gitlab.com/autofitcloud/git-remote-aws and here is a very insightful post: https://rovaughn.github.io/2015-2-9.html
